org.opends.sdk.ldif
Class LDIFInputStreamReader

java.lang.Object
  org.opends.sdk.ldif.LDIFInputStreamReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, ChangeRecordReader
public final class LDIFInputStreamReader
extends Object
implements ChangeRecordReader

A ChangeRecordReader which reads change records from an InputStream using the LDIF record format.

TODO: I think that we need to do optional filtering and schema checking here.

See Also:
RFC 2849 - The LDAP Data Interchange Format (LDIF) - Technical Specification

Method Summary
 void close()
          Closes this change record reader if it not already closed.
 ChangeRecord readChangeRecord()
          Reads the next ChangeRecord, blocking if necessary until a change record is available.
 AttributeSequence readEntry()
          Reads the next Add change record as an AttributeSequence, blocking if necessary until an entry is available.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

close

public void close()
           throws IOException
Closes this change record reader if it not already closed. Note that this method does not need to be called if a previous call of ChangeRecordReader.readChangeRecord() has returned null.

Specified by:
close in interface Closeable
Specified by:
close in interface ChangeRecordReader
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs while closing.

readChangeRecord

public ChangeRecord readChangeRecord()
                              throws IOException
Reads the next ChangeRecord, blocking if necessary until a change record is available. If the next change record does not contain a change type then it will be treated as an Add change record.

Specified by:
readChangeRecord in interface ChangeRecordReader
Returns:
The next ChangeRecord, or null if there are no more change records to be read.
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs while reading the change record.

readEntry

public AttributeSequence readEntry()
                            throws DecodeException,
                                   IOException
Reads the next Add change record as an AttributeSequence, blocking if necessary until an entry is available.

NOTE: implementations must specify how they behave when a non- Add change record is encountered, if this situation is possible.

Specified by:
readEntry in interface ChangeRecordReader
Returns:
The next change record or null if there are no more change records to be read.
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs while reading the change record.
DecodeException
